intro.description:
This cheat sheet helps you to open an image, and shows you how to use the pixel information tool with the file.
The pixel information tool allows you to display information about the pixel pointed by the mouse.
This information includes: x and y positions, pixel intensity, resolution, etc.

item.title: DataVis Perspective
item.description: Please choose the DataVis perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Click to open an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image.

item.title: Select 'Pixel Information' tool
item.description: Select the 'Pixel Information' tool from the toolbar above the plot, tools labelled 'Image tools used to profile and inspect images'. These tools may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.

item.title: Move cursor around to display information
item.description:
When the tool is opened, a cross hair is displayed as a driver to the mouse.
Move the cursor around over the image. In the 'Pixel Information' table view you will see information about the pixel pointed to.
A click on the plot creates a point region and its corresponding information (x, y positions, intensity, etc) is recorded in the table.
Created point regions can be deleted by selecting them in the 'Pixel Information' view table and then clicking on the 'Delete selected point, if there is one' button of the tool bar. It can also be done by selecting 'Delete selected point' of the right-click menu.
In each of the above operations the table view values are updated accordingly.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations, you can now use the pixel information tool.
